definition[0]: before a certain period of time has passed
example[0]: We should have the test results back within 24 hours.
example[1]: He fell sick and died within a matter of weeks.
example[2]: Within an hour of our arrival Caroline was starting to complain.
definition[1]: during a certain period of time
example[3]: the enormous success of televised sport within the last twenty years
example[4]: Within the space of a year, three of the town’s factories have closed down.
definition[2]: less than a certain distance from a particular place
example[5]: The invading troops came within 50 miles of Paris.
example[6]: Within a five mile radius of Ollerton there are several pubs and restaurants.
example[7]: We live within easy reach of (=close to) the shops.
example[8]: Adjust the driver’s seat so that all the controls are within reach (=close enough to touch).
example[9]: As she came within sight of the house, she saw two men getting out of a car.
definition[3]: inside a particular building or area
example[10]: Prisoners who died were buried within the walls of the prison.
example[11]: public footpaths within the national park
example[12]: The rooms within were richly furnished.
example[13]: Baby rabbits for sale. Enquire within.
definition[4]: inside a society, organization, or group of people
example[14]: There have been a lot of changes within the department since I joined.
example[15]: an attempt to reform the system from within
definition[5]: if something stays within a particular limit or set of rules, it does not go beyond that limit
example[16]: We have to operate within a very tight budget.
example[17]: Security firms have to work strictly within the law.
example[18]: You can go anywhere you want within reason (=within reasonable limits).
definition[6]: inside a person’s body or mind
example[19]: Elaine felt a pain deep within her.
example[20]: I’m feeling more relaxed within myself.
